other_tests.findings: The patient's LPL activity was consistently decreased and varied; results suggested heterozygous LPL deficiency or, on some occasions, severely reduced activity typical of homozygous LPL deficiency.
A specific IgG directed against human LPL was detected in the patientâ€™s plasma, suggesting the presence of a circulating LPL inhibitor.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Under immunosuppressive treatment, there was a consistent 40% decrease in plasma triglyceride concentrations.

other_tests.findings: Three sequential tests indicated that under treatment, plasma triglyceride concentration was decreased by 38% compared to when not treated.
other_tests.changes_over_time: During the following 18 months after treatment initiation, no recurrent acute pancreatitis was observed.
